characters: PULL UP AND UP AND UP
EXT BRADDOCK BACKYARD AND POOL AREA

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Moving through clouds.  The clouds separate and, far belo see a giant outdoor amphitheatre.  There is no SOUND but As we move closer to the amphitheatre, we can hear SNATCH and PHRASES as though from a public address system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in cap and gown, standing in front of a microphone.  The BLOWING.  He has to hold on to the papers from which he i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of expressionless STUDENTS are sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and today it is right that we should ask ourselves the one most important question: What is the purpose of these years, the purpose for all this demanding work, the purpose for the sacrifices made those who love us?  Were there NOT a purpose, then all of these past years of struggle, of fierce competition and of uncom- promising ambition would be mean- ingless.  But, of course, there is a purpose and I must tell it to you.  I ask you to remember this purpose always and I pledge that I shall endeavor to carry it with me forever.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: staring at him impassively.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN SHOTS
dialogues.text: of impassive students, seated, watching; of Ben standing alone on the huge amphitheatre stage; of CLOSEUPS of Ben speaking; of loudspeakers; of wind-blown papers on the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The purpose, my fellow graduates -  the purpose is - He stops, trying to think of the word.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He begins to sweat.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: watching. 10        SHOT - PODIUM of AMPHITHEATRE Ben's hands searching through the pages of his speech. The pages begin to blow away in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - there is a reason, my friends, and the reason is -

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He is in a panic.  He looks up from his papers at the aud

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: The audience is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the reason is - the purpose is - SOUND of the WIND becoming the ROAR of an AIRCRAFT coming us through the air.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Huge and empty.  SOUND of AIRCRAFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, we are about to begin our descent into Los Angeles - SOUND of a SONIC BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: His eyes open suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound you have just heard is the landing gear locking into place.  The Los Angeles weather is clear and the temperature is a pleasant 72.  We do not expect any traffic delay and will make our four hour and eighteen minute flight plan smack on the nose.  We enjoyed having you on board and look forward to seeing you again in the near future.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: PULL BACK SLOWLY from a CLOSEUP of a television screen wi snow on it to reveal a long row of television sets along ceiling of the aircraft.  There is snow on all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK from the CLOSEUP of Ben to reveal a row of pass staring straight ahead, their headsets on.  Ben turns and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Los Angeles, at night, its lights stretching endlessly in direction. SOUND - MUZAC and the STEWARDESS' LANDING SPEECH.

dialogues.speaker: START OF MAIN TITLES
dialogues.text: UNDER titles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen please fasten your seat belts in preparation for the landing and observe the no smoking sign.  After we land, you will notice an increase in the sound level as the thrust of the engines is reversed to help reduce forward speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and the other passengers on the automatic sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your attention, please!  American Airlines Flight Number 4, 21 Club service, non-stop to New York is now leaving from Gate Number 40.  All aboard, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes are open and he is trying to remember something. There are the SOUNDS of many people TALKING and LAUGHING in other rooms.  A RADIO nearby PLAYS MUSIC.  After a while, there is the SOUND of a DOOR OPENING.  The SOUNDS of the people TALKING are lower.  MRS. TERHUNE'S voice can be heard among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- associate editor of the college newspaper in his junior year -  managing editor in his senior year - The SOUND of the DOOR CLOSING.  Mrs. Terhune's VOICE and the VOICES of the other guests FADE DOWN.  Mrs. Terhune's VOICE can be HEARD with varying clarity through the remainder of the sequence. After a few moments, there is the SOUND of a LIGHT SWITCH being SNAPPED and light, as though from an overhead fixtu falls across BEN's face.  He does not move. After a few moments, there is the SOUND of the RADIO bein SNAPPED OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Ben's mouth opens a little bit and closes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests are all downstairs, Ben.  They're all waiting to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Dad - could you explain to them that I have to be alone for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are all our good friends, Ben.  Most of them have known you since - well - practically since you were born. Ben has not moved.  Now the bed on which he is lying move as though someone has sat down upon it next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Ben? The CAMERA BEGINS TO PULL BACK SLOWLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - worried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what? Ben

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess - about my future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I want it to be -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different. As Ben says this, the door to the bedroom opens and MRS. BRADDOCK looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No - we're just on our way downstairs! Mr. Braddock gets off the bed and goes to a chair and picks up Ben's jacket which is lying across it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Carlsons' are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Braddock)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are? (to Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Mr. Braddock puts the jacket on Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came all the way from Tarzana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wonderful thing to have so many devoted friends. They move out of the door, Mr. Braddock steering Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHIL and MIMI CARLSON are coming up the stairs as the Braddocks are moving down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - there's our award winning scholar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all very proud of you, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mrs. Carlson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the new car out there? The little red Wop job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Ben's graduation present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting his arm across Ben's shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't have much trouble picking them up in that, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls.  The chicks.  The - the teeny boppers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Ben has gotten beyond the teeny bopper stage - haven't you, Ben? Mrs. Carlson gives Ben a broad wink.  Ben tries to smile and return the wink politely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. They reach the hall at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me - I think I'd just like to check something on the car for a minute - Ben moves to the front door and opens it.  MR. LOOMIS steps into the house and grabs Ben's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the track star himself. How are you, track star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fine, Mr. Loomis. Mr. Loomis closes the door and pushes Ben back down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get a drink and then I want to hear all about that thing you won.  That Hopperman award.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helpingham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helpingham!  Right!  Now you wait right here. Mr. Loomis turns and goes into the dining room.  Ben moves back to the stairway as THREE LADIES come out of the living room.  One lady takes Ben's right hand, anothe lady his left, the third fingers the front of his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben - we're all so proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proud, proud, proud, proud, proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to go upstairs for a minute -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - I meant with your future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - that's a little hard to say - MR. MCQUIRE appears behind Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben! Ben (to the ladies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. (he turns around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McQuire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overwhelmed with pride)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McQuire. Mr. McQuire takes Ben's arm and steers him down the hall toward the back of the house and out through the back doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pool is eerily lit.  There are FOUR PEOPLE standing a TALKING, drinks in their hands, at the back of the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben - I just want to say one word to you - just one word -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you listening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gravely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plastics. They look at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly how do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a great future in plastics. Think about it.  Will you think about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Enough said.  That's a deal. Mr. McQuire turns and walks back into the house.  The people at the other end of the yard look toward Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he is now.  Here's Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me just a minute - Ben goes into the house through the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see through the windows of the house, Ben making h way through people trying to stop him and speak to him as goes through rooms, up the stairs and to his room. SOUND of a door SLAMMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben stands with his back against the door.  The SOUNDS of PARTY downstairs and, as Ben walks across the room to a window, the SOUND of the WIND. 32A        SHOT - LONG SHOT (Location) Over Ben to pool area and people below.  SOUND of the doo OPENING.  Ben turns.  MRS. ROBINSON enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  I guess this isn't the bathroom, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's down the hall. They stand for a moment, loocking at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, thank you.  The bathroom is down at the end of the hall. Mrs. Robinson moves into the room and sits on the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mrs. Robinson, I don't mean to be rude but - Mrs. Robinson takes a cigarette from her purse and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there an ashtray in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - I forgot.  The track star doesn't smoke. She blows out the match and puts it down carefully on the bedspread.  Ben picks up a wastebasket, walks over to the bed, picks up the match and puts it in the wastebasket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is what a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is you're upset about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - no.  I'm just sort of disturbed about things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In general.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. There is a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, I want to ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take me home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband took the car.  Will you drive me home? Ben reaches into his pocket and hands Mrs. Robinson a set of car keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here - you take it. Mrs. Robinson looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how to work a foreign shift? Mrs. Robinson shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (there is a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. She throws the keys to him.  He catches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING THROUGH THE OPEN FRONT DOOR.  Mr. Braddock is talking to the Terhunes at the door.  Ben and Mrs. Robinson come down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad - Mrs. Robinson needs a ride home.  I'll be right back. Mr. Braddock pats Ben on the shoulder.  Mrs. Robinson is walking ahead through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she passes the CAMERA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car comes to a stop in the Robinson driveway.  They s for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. She doesn't move.  Ben gets out and goes around to her si and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you come in, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to come in till I get the lights on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't feel safe until I get the lights on. They move to the door.  She takes out her key and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind walking ahead of me to the sun porch.  I feel funny about coming into a dark house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's light in there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Ben turns and walks down the hall.  They enter sunroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you drink?  Bourbon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - I drove you home.  I was glad to do it.  But I have some things on my mind.  Can you understand that? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you drink? He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - I'm sorry to be this way, but I don't want to be alone in this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please wait till my husband gets home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When is he coming back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She pours herself a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She hands him a drink.  There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you always this much afraid of being alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why can't you just lock the doors and go to bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very nuerotic. She turns on the phonograph.  SOUND of PHONOGRAPH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask you a question? Ben looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've known me nearly all of your life.  You must have formed some opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I've always thought that you were a very - nice - person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know I was an alcoholic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - I think I should be going -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson - if you don't mind my saying so - this conversation is getting a little strange.  Now I'm sure that Mr. Robinson will be here any minute and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband will be back quite late. They look at each other.  Ben is half standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should be gone for several hours. She takes a step toward him.  He puts his hand up and retreats around the other side of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, Mrs. Robinson, oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson, you didn't - I mean you didn't expect -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean - you didn't really think that I would do something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, Mrs. Robinson, here we are, you've got me into your house.  You give me a drink.  You put on music, now you start opening up your personal life to me and tell me your husband won't be home for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson - you are trying to seduce me. There is a pause.  She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why no.  I hadn't thought of it. I feel rather flattered that you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson, will you forgive me for what I just said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not all right, it's the worst thing I've ever said to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please forgive me.  Because I like you.  I don't think of you that way.  But I'm mixed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Now finish your drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson, it makes me sick that I said that to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll forget it right now. Finish your drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen Elaine's portrait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her portrait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had it done last Christmas. Would you like to see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very much. We move with Mrs. Robinson and Ben out of the sunroom, into the hall, up the stairs and along the hall to the doorway to Elaine's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben moves into the room and looks up at the portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine certainly is an attractive girl, isn't she? In the b.g. Mrs. Robinson watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the portrait)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember her as having brown eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you unzip my dress? He steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well, goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't you unzip my dress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather not, Mrs. Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you still think I'm trying to seduce you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.  But I just feel a little funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - you've known me all your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.  But I'm -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. She turns her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard for me to reach. Ben reaches forward and pulls the zipper down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Ben walks toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you so scared of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not scared, Mrs. Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do you keep running away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're going to bed.  I don't think I should be up here. Mrs. Robinson lets her dress fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you ever seen anybody in a slip before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have - He looks up at the portrait of Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just - Look - what if Mr. Robinson walked in right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it would look pretty funny, wouldn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think he trusts us together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he does.  But he might get the wrong idea. Anyone might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see why.  I'm twice as old as you are.  How could anyone think -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they would!  Don't you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - I'm not trying to seduce you.  I wish you'd -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.  But please, Mrs. Robinson.  This is difficult for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I am confused about things.  I can't tell what I'm imagining.  I can't tell what's real.  I can't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to seduce you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you're trying to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going home now.  I apologize for what I said.  I hope you can forget it.  But I'm going home right now. Benjamin walks out of the door and down the hall.  The CAMERA PUSHES with him to the door.  We see the entire stairway and part of the downstairs hall.  Ben gets to the stairs and starts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you bring up my purse before you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go now.  I'm sorry. Mrs. Robinson walks into the hall.  Her back is to us. She is holding her dress in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't want to put this on again.  Won't you bring it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On that chair in the hall. She walks out of the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well here's the purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you bring it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'll hand it to you. Ben starts back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to the railing and I'll hand it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - I am getting pretty tired of all this suspicion. Now if you won't do me a simple favor I don't know what. Ben appears as he slowly climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting it on the top step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, Benjamin, will you stop acting that way and bring me the purse? Ben gets to the top of the stairs, and starts slowly down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting it here by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you bring it in to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Put it in the room where we were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks quickly into Elaine's room, crosses to the bed and puts the purse down.  As he starts to turn back, he looks up at Elaine's portrait.  There is a movement reflected in the glass of the portrait.  He turns quickly.  Mrs. Robinson, naked, is shutting the door to the bedroom behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out. She turns the lock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from that door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to say something first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - I want you to know I'm available to you.  If you won't sleep with me this time -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you won't sleep with me this time, Benjamin, I want you to know you can call me up any time you want and we'll make some kind of arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand what I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Yes.  Let me out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I find you very attractive and any time - There is the SOUND of a CAR in the driveway outside. Ben leaps at the door, pushes Mrs. Robinson aside, struggles with the door, gets the door open, runs into the hall and down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben rushes into the sunroom and sits down.  SOUND of FOOTSTEPS on the driveway outside.  Ben jumps up, gets the glass he had been drinking from and sits down again. SOUND of the front door OPENING and CLOSING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Ben's car in front?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir! FOOTSTEPS approach the sunroom.  MR. ROBINSON enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drove - I drove Mrs. Robinson home.  She wanted me to drive her home so I - I drove her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swell.  I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's upstairs.  She wanted me to wait down here till you got home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing guard over the old castle, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Mr. Robinson reaches for Ben's glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  It looks like you need a refill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anything wrong?  You look a little shaken up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No - I'm just - I'm just a little worried about my future.  I'm a little upset about my future. Mr. Robinson takes the glass from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Let's have a nightcap together. Mr. Robinson turns his back to Ben to mix the drinks. Ben takes several deep breaths, straightens his tie and checks to see if his fly is okay.  Mr. Robinson turns and brings him the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben - how old are you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty.  I'll be twenty-one next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking out a cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a hell of a good age to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was that age again. Because, Ben -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never be young again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, can I say something to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have we known each other now? Ben shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you and I known each other?  How long have your Dad and I been partners?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've watched you grow up, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In many ways I feel as though you were my own son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I hope you won't mind my giving you a friendly piece of advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben - I think - I think you ought to be taking it a little easier right now than you seem to. Ben nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sow a few wild oats.  Take things as they come.  Have a good time with the girls and so forth. Mrs. Robinson enters the room.  She is now wearing the dress she wore earlier.  Ben starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get up. Ben sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just telling Ben here he ought to sow a few wild oats. Have a good time while he can. You think that's sound advice? Mrs. Robinson nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. He stands.  Mr. Robinson stands up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have yourself a few flings this summer.  I bet you're quite a ladies' man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  You look like the kind of guy that has to fight them off. (to Mrs. Robinson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't he look to you like the kind of guy who has to fight them off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he does. They start out of the sunroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh say - Elaine gets down from Berkeley on Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben - I want you to give her a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Mr. Robinson opens the front door and Ben goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING OVER THE CAR toward the house.  Ben comes toward the car.  Mrs. Robinson appears in the doorway; the light behind her makes it difficult to see her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for taking me home. Ben nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you soon, I hope. Ben continues to walk toward us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen - your attention, please - for this after- noon's feature attraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun shines brightly.  Standing and sitting around the pool are Mr. and Mrs. Braddock, their friends MR. and MRS. ARNOLD, and the Arnold children, PETER and LOUISE, who are eight or nine.  Watching from across the fence on one side of the house: the young girl from next door and her boy friend.  Across the fence on the other side of the house: a quartet of adults, formally dressed as though for a cocktail party, holding drinks and watch- ing.  One of them holds a baby.  The Braddocks, the Arnolds and their children are dressed in California Contemporary Sport Style: the adults in styles infinitely too young for them, the children in styles infinitely too old for them. Mr. Braddock stands alone at the end of the pool near the house.  The others are grouped, more or less, at the othe end.  Mr. Braddock is hamming it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, over there -- I mean you! Your attention please! Mr. Braddock has moved over by one of the windows of the house, the window into the kitchen.  He speaks quickly - in a fake sotto voce - towards the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready in there, feature attraction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I speak to you for a second, Dad? But Mr. Braddock has already moved away from the window and is readdressing his audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - what was I saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feature attraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Hey - I'm glad to see you're paying attention.  A feature attraction that will be one of the most astounding events ever to take place in this particular backyard. They all laugh and some applaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm going to ask for a big round of applause to bring this boy out here - wait a minute - let me amend that - to bring this young man out here - because today he is twenty-one-years- old -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his hands like a megaphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get on with the show!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hang on a minute because I have a few words to say -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always do. They laugh; Mrs. Arnold makes a face at Mr. Arnold as he grinningly acknowledges the reponse to his snappy comeback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad - could we just talk about this for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-one-years-old, ladies and gentlemen; four of those years spent accomplishing some rather extraordinary things at one of our nation's leading seats of learning -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On with the show!  On with the show!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hold them much longer, Ben.  You better get out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to discuss this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his audience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This boy - I'm sorry - this young man - is soon to continue his education as a Frank Halping- ham Award Scholar - but before he does - Mr. Braddock darts back to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - before he does - (to the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're disappointing them, Ben. You're disappointing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad - can you listen -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you ten seconds. (back to the people)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is going to give us a practical demonstration of what I feel safe in saying is a pretty exciting birthday present - and it better work or I'm out over two hundred bucks - so let's hear it for - Mr. Braddock moves to the screen door and pushes it open. It slams against the wall inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Benjamin Braddock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the back of the hall, inside the house, stands Ben, dressed in a full length skin diver's wet suit, flippers on his feet, the oxygen tank strapped to his back, the mask pushed up his forehead, the air hose dangling. He holds a spear gun in his hand. The people applaud.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: The people in the backyard.  His father stands just outside the screen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks - this remarkable young man is going to perform for you some spectacular and amazing feats of daring in water that is over six feet deep - Ben's arms come into view and pull the mask down. We are now looking through the mask as we MOVE FORWARD down the hall.  Everything is slightly distorted through the glass.  Ben's hand comes up again with the breathing apparatus in it. SOUND: the rythmic PUMPING of air, obliterating the SOUND of the people around the pool who seem to be applauding and chattering noiselessly. We MOVE out of the door and toward the pool.  Mr. Braddoc is running back and forth, clapping his hands and delivering his now soundless pitch. We MOVE DOWN the steps and into the shallow end of the pool.  Mr. Braddock is moving along the side of the pool, motioning toward us to come down to the deep end.  He joins Mr. Arnold at the far end of the pool.  They both begin to motion us toward them. We get to the deep end of the pool.  Mr. Braddock signals us with his hand to go under.  He kneels down by the edge of the pool and reaches out with his hand and pushes us under.  He has a big smile. We SURFACE again and PAN AROUND for a last look.  The figures, through the slightly distorted glass of the mask of Mrs. Arnold and Mrs. Braddock, watching and smiling; the neighbors on each side of the house, looking over the fences and laughing and pointing; Mr. Arnold nodding encouragement and talking; Mr. Braddock on his knees, smiling and trying to reach out far enough to push us under.  We GO UNDER and SINK to the bottom of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down on the pool, on Ben's black suited body at the bottom and the people standing around the pool, looki down into it.

dialogues.speaker: PULL UP AND UP AND UP
dialogues.text: Until there are thirty houses below us, with its owners, swimming, playing, eating, cooking, reading, dancing, sunbathing, constructing and gardening around thirty pool SOUND of Ben's BREATHING APPARATUS, fading into the SOUND of the WIND. Hold for a few seconds, then: SOUND of a dime DROPPING into a pay phone and DIALING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a phone booth.  The booth is in the entrance area of the hotel between the lobby and the driveway.  Ben holds the receiver to his ear.  SOUND of PHONE RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson - I don't quite know how to put this -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - I was thinking about that time after the party -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and I was wondering if I could buy you a drink or something -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh - The Taft Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get a room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Now I know it's pretty late and if you'd rather -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there in an hour. SOUND of her HANGING UP.  Ben hangs up slowly. He stands up in the booth, looks around, moves about uncomfortably for a few moments, removes his jacket and carrying it folded across his arm in front of him, leaves the phone booth and crosses to the doors that lead to the main lobby.  As he is about to go in, the doors open and a group of VERY OLD PEOPLE start coming out, filling the doorway and moving very slowly, mutterin to each other and helping each other out of the door and down the steps.  Ben holds one of the doors open for them and stands politely to one side.  As they get through, Ben starts to move inside.  At that moment, A DOZEN YOUNG PEOPLE, dressed as though for a high school dance, push him to one side and move past him into the lobby.  He moves back against the other door, holding it open and allowing them to go in first.  He smiles politely and the pay no attention to him at all.  He follows them into the lobby.  They move toward the front desk and he moves with them.  One of the boys at the front of the group leans in and says something to the CLERK behind the desk. The clerk points across the lobby and says something to him.  There are the SOUNDS of an orchestra PLAYING some- where.  The group of young people passes by the desk and Ben moves in behind them.  He pauses at the desk and looks apprehensively at the hundreds of pigeon holes agai the wall with the room numbers painted under them and the keys dangling suggestively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Oh - no - I'm just - He points vaguely in the direction of the other young people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you here for an affair, sir? Terror and disbelief start in Ben's eyes.  He looks helplessly at the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Singleman party, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - yes.  The Singleman party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the main ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh - thank you. Ben backs off and turns and starts across the lobby. He puts on his jacket as he goes.  He gets to the entranc to the main ballroom.  He pauses at the door, looks in. What he sees:  People dancing, talking, sitting, etc. He turns back toward te lobby.  He stops. What he sees:  The room clerk scross the lobby watching him. Ben flashes a huge smile and points in toward the ballroo as though to express his joy at finding the Singleman affair inside, then turns back and enters the ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ben steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Ben turns.  Four people stand in a row.  Official greeter they are:  A MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN, AN OLDER MAN, AN ELDERLY LADY AND A TWELVE-YEAR-OLD BOY, dressed formally and they are smiling with great determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. It is the older lady who has said hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be one of the Porters. She grasps Ben's hand and shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - actually I'm not -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to know my sister, Miss DeWitte - MISS DEWITTE, who, from the looks of things, always has been and always will be, Miss DeWitte, takes Ben's hand. MISS DeWITTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do, Miss DeWitte?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and my husband, Mr. Singleman - Ben finds himself shaking the twelve-year-old boy's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - sorry -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Jeffrey, of course. Ben switches to Mr. Singleman's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get your name, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin Braddock, sir. Mrs. Singleman looks at the seating list she has been holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braddock - Braddock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I'm afraid -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find your table in a moment. Braddock.  Not Braniff?  We have a Braniff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - actually I'm just looking for a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not with your party - I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - I don't get it. Ben is backing out. MISS DeWITTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've enjoyed meeting you, Mr. Braniff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela - please! Ben backs out of the ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben crosses the lobby, passing PEOPLE going in and out of the hotel.  He stops at the entrance of the Veranda Room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a large room with a bar and many tables along the windows that look out over the hotel grounds.  It is quit dark and cool inside and there are no more than a dozen people seated around. The CAMERA STAYS at the door as Ben walks into the room and crosses to the far end where he sits down at the tabl by the window. PUSH IN toward Ben as he sits there.  MUZAK is playing.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: sitting smoking.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: sitting.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: sitting drinking.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: In the door to the lobby in the b.g. is Mrs. Robinson. She pauses, looks into the room, sees Ben and starts toward him.  Ben is looking out the window.  He does not see her approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Hello.  Hello. He rises quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. He pulls out a chair, for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. They sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well.  Thank you. Ben tries to smile then looks out the window, then down at the center of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drink?  Of course. Ben looks toward a passing WAITER and raises his hand. The waiter pays no attention.  Ben looks back at Mrs. Robinson apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiter! For a moment, the noise in the room seems to recede.  The waiter stops in his tracks, turns toward them.  The waite moves to their table.  The noise in the room comes back. The waiter looks at Mrs. Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will have a martini. WAITER No. 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, madam. The waiter moves away.  Ben watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be so nervous, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous.  Well, I am a bit nervous.  I mean it's - it's pretty hard to be suave when you're - He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get us a room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you gotten us a room yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I don't.  I mean I could. Or we could just talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?  Oh no.  No.  I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to get it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I get it?  Well - I will then. (he stands up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll excuse me. Ben walks out of the Veranda Room and into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks to the front desk and stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room.  I'd like a room, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single room or a double room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single.  Just for myself, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you sign the register, please? He pushes the card and a pen toward Ben.  Ben writes his name on the card and then stares at it for a moment, crumples it up and fills out a second card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anything wrong, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  No.  Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a key from behind the counter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any luggage, Mister -- (looks at registration card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladstone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luggage?  Yes.  Yes.  I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is your luggage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's in the car.  It's out in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, sir.  I'll have a porter bring it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I'd - I'd rather not go to the trouble of bringing it all in.  I just have a toothbrush.  I can get it my- self.  If that's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Ben reaches for the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a porter show you the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well actually, I'd just as soon find it myself.  I just have the toothbrush to carry up and I think I can manage it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, sir. He hands Ben the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson sits, patiently and calmly.  Her face betra absolutely nothing as she stares ahead of her and sips her martini. WAITER No. 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson. She looks up.  A waiter is standing next to the table with a telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? The waiter plugs the phone into the wall socket next to the table and hands her the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The waiter nods and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin Braddock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin -- where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you look through the glass. Mrs. Robinson turns in her chair and looks through the glass into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is in the phone booth in the lobby no more than twent feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over Ben's shoulder, we can see his face reflected in the glass door and, through it, Mrs. Robinson sitting in the Veranda Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a single room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's one thing.  The desk clerk seemed to be a little bit suspicious. I mean - I don't know what their policy is - but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - do you want to go up first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes - I think that would be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be up in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - goodbye then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there something you want to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I want you to know how much I appreciate this - really -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room number, Benjamin.  I think you ought to tell me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?  You're absolutely right.  Absolutely. It's 512.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.  Well - I'll see you later, Mrs. Robinson. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves the hpone booth and walks back into the main lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he passes the desk, on his way to the elevator, he sta to pat his breast pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it. The desk clerk looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say I've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toothbrush.  I got it all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Well - goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, sir. Ben walks out of shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben leaves elevator, walks down corridor to hotel room an opens door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben closes the door behind him and leans with his back ag it for a few moments looking at the room.  The only light is that coming in the window.  Ben turns on the light swi on the wall near the door.  The room blazes with the ligh from three lamps and an overhead fixture.  He turns the s off.  He crosses to the bathroom.  Ben steps in and turns the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben steps out, moves to the window.  We see the pool area through the window.  Ben closes the blinds. 61Cont.There is a KNOCK on the door.  Ben crosses to the opens it.  Mrs. Robinson moves to the bureau and puts her purse and gloves on it.  She looks at herself in the mirror for a moment then turns slowly, looking at the roo finally ending on Ben's face.  She steps toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? He clears his throat and then he kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get undressed now.  Is that all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Shall I - I mean shall I just stand here?  I mean - I don't know what you want me to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - sure.  Thank you. She takes off her jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you bring me a hanger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hanger. Ben opens the closet door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - yes.  Wood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood or wire?  They have both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either one will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He brings her a hanger.  She puts her jacket on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you help me with this, please? She turns her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly. He undoes the zipper at her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. She turns and looks at him.  He backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would this be easier for you in the dark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson - I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all terribly wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - do you find me undesirable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, Mrs. Robinson.  I think - I think you're the most attractive of all my parents' friends. I just don't think we could possibly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - but look - maybe we could do something else together, Mrs. Robinson - would you like to go to a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, is this your first time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this - what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, isn't it?  It is your first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a laugh, Mrs. Robinson. That's really a laugh.  Ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can admit that, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing to be ashamed of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your first time -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said it was my first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you're afraid -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - of bring - inadequate -  I mean just because you happen to be inadequate in one way -

dialogues.speaker: INADEQUATE
dialogues.text: LONG pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to dress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move. He slams the bathroom door shut.  The light in the room disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The midsummer sun beats down on the Braddock swimming poo and on Ben who lies on a rubber raft in the middle of the pool.  Ben wears dark glasses, is deeply tanned, and hold a beer can in one hand. SOUNDS:  teenagers YELLING and swimming in nearby pools; a radio PLAYING rock and roll; a television set TUNED to a ball game.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: drifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: drifting.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: SOUND of the back door CLOSING.  Ben opens his eyes and moves his head slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Braddock is passionately stoking a barbeque fire.  Mr Braddock is going toward him from the house, carrying som ominously large thing wrapped in tinfoil.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He rolls off the raft and swims to the end of the pool. climbs out, walks to the back door, takes his shirt from chair and starts to put it on as he opens the back door a goes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben has just shut the door to the bathroom behind him.  H is wearing his shirt, buttoned, and no trousers. PAN WITH BEN as he walks across the room past Mrs. Robins who is standing in front of the bureau taking off her bra let and watch.  He moves to a chair and sits. He picks up a cigarette from an ashtray on a table next to the chair.  Mrs. Robinson moves in to Ben, kneels in front of him and starts to unbutton his shirt. He takes the cigarette out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: We now see behind Ben the door that leads from the Braddo den, in which Ben is sitting.  In the dining room, Mr. and Mrs. Braddock are sitting, having their dinner, looki through the doorways toward Ben.  Ben stands, crosses bac to the door to the den and shuts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Ben's back as he returns to the chair and sits.  A television set, facing the chair, is on.  Ben picks up a can of beer and drinks from it.  An animated cartoon is playing on the television set.  Ben watches it.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Ben's face, watching.  PUSH IN to CLOSEUP of his face.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of television set and cartoon.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Ben watching.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP test pattern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP Ben watching.  PULL BACK and we are in the Taft Hotel Room.  Ben is sitting on the bed, leaning against the headboard, watching the television set which is on a stand facing the bed. SOUND of the HUM of the test pattern. PULL BACK to a WIDE SHOT of the room, lit only by the lig from the television set.  Mrs. Robinson walks into the sh half dressed.  She passes between Ben and the television set and goes out of frame.  Ben continues to stare at the SOUND of a ZIPPER being pulled up. Mrs. Robinson appears again and passes the other way. SOUND of BRACELETS being put on. Mrs. Robinson passes back the other way again. SOUND of CLOTHING being put on and a PURSE being snapped closed.  Mrs. Robinson, now fully dressed and carrying her purse, passes through again and, without looking at Ben, goes to the door of the hotel room, opens it and exits.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: SOUND of DOOR closing.  Follow Ben as he gets up and move to the windows of what is now his BEDROOM in the Braddock house.  He opens the closed blinds over the window.  The sun is bright outside.  His bathing suit is on the window sill.  He takes the suit and puts it on.  He moves to the bedroom door, opens it and goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Mrs. Braddock in the kitchen.  Ben comes through the back door, moves to the pool and dives in.  The raft floats in the center of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Ben swims toward us the length of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Ben surfaces and, in one movememt, pulls himself up on the raft and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - lands on top of Mrs. Robinson on the bed.  He stays on top of her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben - what are you doing? Ben turns toward us and looks.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Mr. Braddock standing by the side of the pool.  The sun is behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I would say that I'm just drifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - here - in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - it's very comfortable - just to drift here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you thought about graduate school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you  mind telling me then - what were those four years of college for?  What was the point of all that hard work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying unsuccessfully to control himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen, Ben.  I think it's a very good thing that a young man - after he's done some very good work - should have a chance to relax and enjoy himself, and lie around, and drink beer and so on.  But after a few weeks I believe that person would want to take some stock in him- self and his situation and start to think about getting off his ass. Mrs. Braddock steps in beside Mr. Braddock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Robinson's are here. Mr. Robinson steps in beside the others.  They blot out the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ben.  What are you doing with yourself these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - not too much.  Taking it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'd do if I could. Nothing wrong with that.  Hey Ben, Elaine's coming down from Berkeley soon.  I want you to call her up this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I just think you two would hit it off real well together. Mrs. Robinson steps in beside them.  (A long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Mrs. Robinson, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs. Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, halfway dressed to go out, in slacks, shirt and tie, sits in a chair.  The door opens and Mrs. Braddock enters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?  I'm going to ask you something but you don't have to tell me if you don't want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm going to ask you what you do when you go off at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I go off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me if you don't want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I do.  I want to tell you. There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drive around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you don't drive around from midnight until noon the next day, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you do?  Do you meet someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet someone? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this is your business, Benjamin. (she starts toward the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wait.  Wait. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't meet anyone, mother, but why did you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, I'm not going to pry into your affairs, but I'd rather you didn't say anything at all than be dishonest. Goodnight, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, wait. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm being dishonest? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well why do you - why do you think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know you don't drive around for twelve hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well, I don't.  Shall I tell you what I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't want you to make up something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.  But I'm - I'm not very proud of what I do.  I usually get kind of drunk.  I usually drive over to Los Angeles and go to some bars and get kind of drunk.  Then I take a hotel room.  So I won't have to drive home on the freeway.  I mean it kind of scares me to drive home after -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe me, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want you to.  Please. Please will you believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson's hands are undoing his necktie.  Ben is dressed as in previous scene, plus a jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. (he pushes her hand away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down a minute. Mrs. Robinson looks at him and raises her eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please sit down a minute. Mrs. Robinson walks to the bed and sits.  She reaches down to take off a shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you leave that shoe on for a minute.  Please. She straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now - do you think we could say a few words to each other first this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I mean are we dead or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I just don't think we have much to say to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we ever do is come up here and throw off the clothes and leap into bed together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you tired of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.  No.  But do you think we could liven it up with a few words now and then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what do you want to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.  Anything at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to tell me about some of your college experiences?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. MRS. ROBINSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson.  If that's the best we can do let's just get the god- damn clothes off and -- She reaches for her shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it on!  Now we are going to do this thing.  We are going to have a conversation.  Think of another topic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art.  That's a good subject. You start it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You start it off.  I don't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do.  I know quite a bit about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art.  Well what do you want to know about it. She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you interested more in modern art or more in classical art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not interested in art?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do you want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. Ben nods and looks at the rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I take off my clothes now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Think of another topic. Tell me what you did today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want me to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got up. Ben starts shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to hear it or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  But you might try and spice it up with a little originality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got up.  I ate breakfast and went shopping.  During the after- noon I read a novel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What novel did you read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember. Ben nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I fixed supper for my husband and waited until -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband!  Mrs. Robinson! There's something we could have a conversation about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean everything.  I don't know anything about how you - how you work this.  I don't know how you get out of the house at night.  I don't know the risk involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no risk? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you get out of the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walk right out the door. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, this isn't a very interesting topic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  Now tell me.  How do you know he won't wake up sometime and follow you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he takes sleeping pills. He takes three sleeping pills every night at ten o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the noise from the car.  What if -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driveway's on my side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking, Mrs. Robinson. We're talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's keep going here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I undress and talk at the same time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.  You say the driveway's on your side of the house.  So I guess you don't sleep in the same room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you don't - I mean I don't like to seem like I'm prying but I guess you don't sleep together or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well how long has this been going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the ceiling for a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.  Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have not slept with your husband for five years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now and then.  He geats drunk a few times a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On New Year's Eve.  Sometimes on his birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, is this interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you don't love him.  You wouldn't say you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've talked enough, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  So you wouldn't say you loved him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Benjamin.  I don't hate him. Unhook my blouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unhooking her blouse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well how do you feel about him, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's kind of a bad situation then, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it doesn't sound like it could be much worse.  If you hated him at least you'd hate him. She nods and takes off her blouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you loved him once, I assume.  When you first knew him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
