dialogues.text: I never did, Benjamin.  Now let's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, wait a minute.  You married him. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking off her stockings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if you can guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think real hard, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see why you did, unless ...you didn't have to marry him or anything, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.  You had to marry him because you got pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you shocked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I never thought of you and Mr. Robinson as the kind of people who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Now let's get to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  Wait a minute. So how did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean do you feel like telling me what were the circumstances?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not particularly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he a law student at the time? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were a student also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was your major?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you asking me all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm interested, Mrs. Robinson. Now what was your major subject at college?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought you - I guess you kind of lost interest in it over the years then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well how did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean did he take you up to his room with him?  Did you go to a hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, what does it possibly matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd go to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.  In the car you did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we were the first. Ben thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of car was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember the make of the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.  I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a Ford, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Ford!  A Ford!  Goddamnit, a Ford!  That's great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So old Elaine Robinson got started in a Ford. There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk about Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk about Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't want you to. She walks to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well why don't you? She pulls the bedspread down.  Ben begins to remove his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well why is she a big taboo subject all of a sudden? Mrs. Robinson uncovers one of the pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I guess I'll have to ask her out on a date and find out what's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, don't you ever take that girl out. Ben looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well look.  I have no intention of taking her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just kidding around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why shouldn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's hear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hear your reasons, Mrs. Robinson.  Because I think I know what they are. She pulls the covers down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not good enough for her to associate with, am I?  I'm not good enough to even talk about her, am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not dropping it.  Now that's the reason, isn't it? I'm a dirty degenerate, aren't I?  I'm not fit to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good enough for you but I'm too slimy to associate with your daughter.  That's it, isn't it?  ISN'T IT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to hell.  You go straight to hell, Mrs. Robinson.  Do you think I'm proud of myself?  Do you think I'm proud of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir.  I am not proud that I spend my time with a broken- down alcoholic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you think I come here for any reason besides pure boredom, then you're all wrong. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because - Mrs. Robinson this is the sickest, most perverted thing that ever happened to me.  And you do what you want but I'm getting the hell out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goddamn right I am. He starts putting on his shirt.  She sits on the edge of the bed and watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how you feel about me. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I'm a sick and disgusting person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't start this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start acting hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you expect me to be a little hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson, you stand there and tell me I'm not good enough for your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you did. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, I want to apologize to you if that's the impression you got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well two minutes ago you told me I wasn't good enough for your daughter.  Now you say you're sorry I got that impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it.  I don't think you'd be right for each other. But I would never say you weren't as good a person as she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I wouldn't. Mrs. Robinson walks to the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's pretty obvious you don't want me around any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well look - I was kind of upset there.  I'm sorry I said those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's how you feel -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right.  I think I can understand why I'm disgusting to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.  Look - I like you.  I wouldn't keep coming here if I didn't like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if it's sickening for you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not!  I enjoy it!  I look forward to it.  It's the one thing I have to look forward to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I wouldn't.  I would never say it if it wasn't true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I stay then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Please.  I want you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't thank me, because I want you to. There is a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you won't ever take out Elaine, will you?  I want you to promise me that. There is another long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  Why the hell did you bring this up.  It never occured to me to take her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give me your word you won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is absurd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, for christ's sake. I promise I will never take out Elaine Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not talk about it.  Let's not talk at all. At opposite sides of the room, without looking at each other, they begin to take off their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben sits at the table, eating his breakfast and looking at the back of a cereal box.  Mr. and Mrs. Braddock are there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine's back from school.  I think it might be a nice gesture if you asked her out. Benjamin looks at his father for a moment, then continues eating and reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is lying on his bed.  Mrs. Braddock stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think that she's a terribly attractive girl? Because I think she's one of the prettiest girls I've ever seen. Ben gives a small whimper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is lying face down on his raft in the middle of the Braddock pool.  The sun shines down.  His diving mask is on over his eyes.  His face is in the water, looking down at the bottom of the pool.  Mr. and Mrs. Braddock, in their bathing suits, are in the pool, paddling around Ben.  During the entire conversation they continue to swim around and around the raft, trying to talk and keep their heads above the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty embarrassing.  I really don't know what to tell Mr. Robinson.  It's ackward and strained for me every time he suggests that you call up Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time he suggests it, I'll tell him I have no intention of ever calling her up in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess she's not good enough for you, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - Elaine Robinson and I do not get along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?  You haven't seen her since high school.  I guess your evenings, whatever you do with them, are just too valuable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That has nothing to do with it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'll just tell Mr. Robinson that you're just too busy every evening - doing God knows what -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go on like this.  Now if Benjamin absolutely refuses to take her out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - then I'll simply invite all the Robinsons' over for dinner on Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He slides off the raft and goes underwater.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: His hair streaming up, his eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dining room is one tenth its normal size.  At a table for two are seated, jammed in against each other, the three Robinsons and the three Braddocks.  Elaine's back is to us.  Ben is at the other end of the table, facing us.  The Robinsons and Braddocks sit along the sides.  Mrs. Robinson is next to Ben, everyone is eating, looking down at their places.  After a few moment Ben throws his head back ans starts to scream.  As he continues to scream, everyone looks at him except Mrs. Robinson who continues to eat calmly without looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben surfaces and pulls himself up on the side of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go call Elaine now. Mr. and Mrs. Braddock cling exhausted to the raft and try to smile at each other. SOUND:  Ding dong of the Robinson door chimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99        EXT. & INT. ROBINSON FRONT DOOR, HALL AND S The door opens.  Mr. Robinson stands there with a huge smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Braddock - it's about time you got around to this. Come on in.  I'm afraid the young lady isn't quite ready yet - Mr. Robinson turns toward the sunroom.  Mrs. Robinson is sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say to a short one? Bourbon still your drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Mr. Robinson hands him drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see if she's ready. Mr. Robinson exits.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: NOTE  Following dialogue played simultaneously

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen -- this was not                   (from hall) my idea.  It was my father's        Hey -- there she is. idea.                                        America -- t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin -- I thought I made                ELAINE'S VOIC myself perfectly clear about        Daddy - can you fix t this.                                        The clasp is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering urgently)        I'll do it - I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we'll go out to dinner and have a drink and I'll                        ELAINE'S bring her back.  Because it                Is Ben here? was either that or a dinner party for the two families.                        MR. RO And I'm afriad I couldn't                He's in the livi quite handle that, if you                a chat with your don't mind.  I have no intention of ever taking your precious daughter out again in her life.  So don't get upset about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am.  I'm extremely upset about it, Benjamin. Mr. Robinson and ELAINE enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I want you to keep your wits about you tonight.  You never know what tricks Ben picked up back there in the East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT - BEN AND ELAINE in Ben's car.  From the back.  Ben leans forward slightly, pushing the car recklessly in and out of the traffic.  Ben is wearing dark glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're living at home now.  Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what you're going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to graduate school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He leans on the HORN.  The car directly ahead of him does not move to the right.  Ben jerks his car over to th right, swerves around the car ahead, jamming his horn down, and swerves back into the outside lane, giving the driver of the other car an angry look as he passes him. Elaine holds on to the dashboard to keep her balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you always drive like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drab, almost deserted room with formally dressed WAITER Ben and Elaine are seated at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want some dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love some. A waiter moves forward toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring a menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner for two, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Just for her. The waiter moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's all right with you, I'm not hungry. The waiter returns with a menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've changed my mind.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Elaine walking on the strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben pushes through the people crowded in around the entrance.  Without turning around, he waits for Elaine who has difficulty following him.  As she gets to him, he starts forward again.  He starts up the stairs. Elaine is just behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seedy, ugly, three quarters filled.  A tuxedoed HOOD lead them through the tables to a table directly under the sta on which a STRIPPER is in the process of removing her dress.  There is one chair facing the stage, the other wi its back to and up against the stage.  Ben sits down in the chair facing the stage.  Elaine stands for a moment, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. Elaine sits in the chair with her back to the stage. She folds her hands on the table and looks down at them. Ben takes a pair of dark glasses out of his pocket and puts them on.  The two chairs are slightly angled toward each other so that Ben can look up at the stage without looking directly at Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you watch the show? The stripper is reflected in Ben's glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - do you dislike me for some reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - why should I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: She is down to a tasseled bra and g-string.  She is twirling the tassels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're missing a great effect here. Elaine turns around, looks at the stripper and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like that? Elaine doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The stripper sees Elaine look.  The stripper smiles towar Ben and walks toward his table, twirling the tassels as s walks.  Ben smiles as he watches her approaching. The stripper moves directly behind Elaine's chair.  The spotlight from the back of the house falls into Elaine's face.  As it does, Elaine puts her hand up to shield her eyes. The stripper slides a finger into her mouth, wets it and holds it up in the air.  The music stops and a DRUM ROLL starts.  The stripper bends over Elaine's head and begins swinging the tassels so that they rotate in front of Elaine's face.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He leans forward slightly to watch the action.  The swinging tassels are reflected in his glasses. The DRUM ROLL gets louder and faster.  The tassels swing more frantically.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: She pulls her hand down from in front of her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: With Elaine's face reflected in his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Through Ben's glasses.  Elaine's face seen darkly but fully for the first time.  The tassels swing in front of it.  Tears start out of her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He reaches up to remove the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: As the glasses come off and her face is seen in the harsh spill from the spotlight.  The tears are running down her face.  Only her eyes are crying as she looks straight at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: With his glasses off, he watches her.  He reaches forward and puts his hand in the way of the tassels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Some of the customers start to boo.  Ben rises, takes Elaine's arm and leads her toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entrance to the strip joint.  Elaine runs to the bottom of the steps.  The Sunset Strip sidewalk outside is crowded with people moving back and forth.  Ben follow her.  She pushes through the crowd on the sidewalk.  Ben catches her and holds her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - I'm sorry. Elaine leans against the side of the building and pulls her arm away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take me home now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I took you in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd better go home now please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Elaine -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to tell you something. Ben, facing her, keeps moving from side to side, trying to get her to look at him.  She keeps looking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But could I just tell you this one thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole idea - this date and everything.  It was my parents' idea.  They forced me into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - that's very nice of you to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  What I mean is - that's why I've been acting this way. I'm not like this.  I hate myself like this. She starts to cry.  People on the sidewalk are looking at them.  She turns away from them.  Ben moves away from them.  Ben moves around in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen - could you stop crying, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But could you try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She brings both hands up to her face.  Ben looks at her for a few moments in agony.  Then, very determined, he takes her wrists in his hands and pulls them away from her face.  She looks up startled.  She starts to give a little cry but before she can he is kissing her.  She clo her eyes. He brings his fists, containing her hands, up to the side of her face.  He opens his hands against her face, freein her hands.  Her hands move slowly to his wrists and hang on.  After a while she pulls away, turning her head sligh to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - He starts to pull her head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.  Not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Elaine are sitting in the car in a drive-in restaurant.  There are trays hooked onto windows along side of both of them.  They are eating and drinking furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had this feeling - ever since I've graduated - this - kind of compulsion that I have to be rude all the time.  Do you know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like I've been playing some kind of - game - but the rules don't make any sense to me - She is watching him carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - they're being made up by all the wrong people - no - I mean no one makes them up, they seem to have made themselves up. A car with a COUPLE OF TEENAGERS has driven up in the slot on their right.  Its RADIO is tuned into a rock and roll station and it is playing LOUDLY.  Ben leans across Elaine and speaks through the window to the kid behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say - I wonder if I could request you to turn that down a little? The kid turns the radio up.  Ben and Elaine roll their windows up.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: From outside of car.  Ben is talking with great animation - Elaine is watching him.  They are both eating as Ben talks, telling Elaine a story.  Their windows are rolled up. SOUNDS: Cars GUNNING their ENGINES; horns HONKING; radios PLAYING; waitresses YELLING orders; customers YELLING at waitresses; kids LAUGHING and TALKING from car to car; MOTORCYCLES driving in and out, TRAFFIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car coasts silently to a stop in front of the Robinso house.  The RADIO plays QUIETLY.  Ben turns it OFF.  They sit there for a long time without saying anything, Ben's hand touching her shoulder.  It is very quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - maybe I'd better go in. He nods.  They continue to sit there for another long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to come in?  I could make some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean - I wouldn't want to wake anyone up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't.  Let's go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - I was just thinking - look - it's still early - we could do something - go somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. He starts the car immediately and drives away from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to think of where there's a place to have a drink around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there one in the Taft Hotel? There is a SQUEAL of TIRES as Ben almost drives off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I'm just wondering if they have a bar or not.  I mean let's go see.  Let's go see if they do or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Elaine enter the lobby and stand just inside the door.  They start in a few steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Elaine - it seems to me that there isn't a bar in here. I mean - as far as I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course there is.  Look - The Veranda Room - right there. ONE of the CAR PARKERS passes them on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. CAMERS BEGINS TO PULL UP AND AWAY.  A BELLBOY passes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, how are you, sir? The room clerk smiles at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Gladstone. Ben and Elaine stop a few feet into the center of the lobby.  The CAMERA PULLS BACK to a HIGH OVERHEAD SHOT revealing many people moving back and forth in the lobby, passing Ben and Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Gladstone.  How are you this evening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here, Elaine. Let's go somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - do they know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gladstone - how are you? He moves her toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Elaine.  We're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben brings Elaine through the door to the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben - what's happening?  Who is Mr. Gladstone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  They must think I look like this guy Gladstone. PAN WITH THEM as they start down the steps.  Coming up the steps toward them is Miss DeWitte, on the arm of another ELDERLY LADY. MISS DeWITTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Brannif. SOUND:  Car STARTING noisily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Elaine in his car.  He takes his hand off the ignition, jams on the accelerator and drives the car speedily for twenty-one feet and jams on the brakes.  He turns off the ignition and the lights.  He puts his head down on the steering wheel.  He lifts his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - I like you.  I like you so much.  Do you believe that? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the first - you're the first thing for so long that I've liked.  The first person I could stand to be with. She takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean my whole life is such a waste.  It's just nothing.  I'm sorry.  I'll take you home now. He turns the key in the ignition and starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - are having an affair with someone? He freezes with his hand still on the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. He turns off the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  That is not my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just happened.  It was just this thing that happened along with everything else.  Can you understand that? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she married or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  She had a husband and a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they ever find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's all over now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad. He starts the car and drives out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we do something tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the day?  We'll go for a drive or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you really want to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I wouldn't want you to do it unless you really wanted to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - I really do.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: It is raining.  On the seat beside Ben is a package. From the way it is wrapped, we can tell it is a gift. Ben's right hand is on it as he drives.  The radio is playing.  Past Ben and through the windsheild as the Robinson house comes closer and closer.  The front door of the Robinson house opens and Mrs. Robinson comes out, dressed in a housecoat, and, in four or five fast steps, reaches the car, opens the door on the passengers side and climbs in.  Ben moves the package over into his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson - I have a date with Elaine.  We're going for a drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at him for the first time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do exactly what I say. Ben starts the car forward down the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: BEN AND MRS. ROBINSON
dialogues.text: As they drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it seems to me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me very carefully, Benjamin.  You are not to see Elaine again.  Ever.  Those are my orders.  Is that clear? Ben stops the car in front of a house halfway down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can makes things quite unpleasant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to keep Elaine away from you - I am prepared to tell her everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'd better start believing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson, don't wreck it.  I'm asking you please not to wreck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't believe you would do that. Mrs. Robinson looks at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me. There is a pause while Ben looks at her expression.  Then he grabs the keys out of the ignition, opens the door on his side and jumps out of the car, carrying the package. TRACK WITH BEN as he runs up the street and up the drive- way toward the Robinson house.  Ben gets to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes through the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben runs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dressed yet. Ben runs up the stairs.  He still carries the package. Ben gets to the top just as Elaine comes out of the door to her bedroom.  She is wearing a skirt and slip and carrying one shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - I said I wasn't dressed - Ben pushes her back into her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to go over the back fence and I'll meet you on the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - what's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up.  Put your shoes on. Ben turns and looks.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson is just entering the house.

dialogues.speaker: NO.
dialogues.text: He turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is standing in the doorway watching him.  She still holds the shoe in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want to know what's happening. SOUND of Mrs. Robinson's FOOTSTEPS in the hall below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben pulls Elaine around behind the open door.  They stand in the angle formed by the door and the wall as though they are hiding from someone.  Mrs. Robinson's FOOTSTEPS can be heard coming up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - I have to tell you something. He holds her against the wall in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman.  The older woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the one who -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  The married woman - it wasn't just some woman - Mrs. Robinson's FOOTSTEPS can be heard coming down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you telling me? The FOOTSTEPS stop.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE ON ELAINE
dialogues.text: Back in the corner.  Mrs. Robinson's face appears in the crack in the door at Elaine's shoulder.  Elaine looks fro Ben's face to the crack through which she can see her mother's eyes staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please - will somebody tell me - She looks back at Ben, then back at her mother's face aga Mrs. Robinson's eyes watch her through the crack in the door.  Elaine looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - no. Ben backs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God - Moving along the wall as though to keep as far from Ben as possible, Elaine moves away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Elaine walks a few steps toward the other side of the roo then turns back toward Ben.  The tears are starting out of her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - don't cry -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cry. (holds the package out to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. She moves toward him as though to hit him.  He backs into the hall.  Elaine SLAMS the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson stands at the end of it, looking at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He looks at her in horror.  He starts to back down the hall toward the stairs, holding the package against his chest.

dialogues.speaker: BACK FROM MRS. ROBINSON
dialogues.text: She is standing there, perfectly calm.  She gets further and further away as though it is a very long hall in a very bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben sits cross-legged on his bed in the dark, his back against the fishtank, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben drives by in his car.  He looks at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben dressed differently, stands by the window overlooking the backyard.  Over his shoulder, we can see Mr. Braddock down by the pool, dressed in a sweater, cleaning the pool with a long-handled scoop.  Mr. Braddock looks up at Ben' window.  Ben moves aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is standing behind a tree watching the Robinson house.  In the driveway of the Robinson house, Elaine is getting into the Robinson car.  Mr. Robinson is putting Elaine's luggage into the car.  Mrs. Robinson stands at the door.  Mr. Robinson gets into the car and starts it.  The car drives down the driveway and down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, dressed differently again, sits in a chair by his desk.  He is writing.  On the piece of paper is written: DEAR ELAINE, ELAINE, ELAINE, ELAINE, and her name several dozen times.  He stops and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is early morning.  We see a swinging door pushed open to reveal:  Mr. Braddock, dressed in a bathrobe, standing at the kitchen counter by the window through which we can see an orange tree.  Mr. Braddock is pouring orange juice from a MINUTE MAID container.  Ben stands inside door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to marry Elaine Robinson. MR. BRADDOCK STARTS TO SMILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - well - well - He almost giggles as he crosses to Ben and takes his hand to shake it.  Mrs. Braddock appears in the doorway.  Ben is shaking his father's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben says he and Elaine are getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That what he says.  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going up to Berkeley today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Ben - this is so - exciting -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's call the Robinsons. We've got something to celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I think you'll want to wait on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - they don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - when did you decide all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  You talked to Elaine this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  She doesn't know about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know that you're coming up to Berkeley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Actually - she doesn't know about us getting married yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you two talk this over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben - this whole idea sounds pretty half-baked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - it's not.  It's completely baked.  It's a decision I've made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what makes you think she wants to marry you? Ben picks up his suitcase, walks to the door and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't.  To be perfectly honest, she doesn't like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben driving his car (left to right)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Elaine - I am now visiting Berkeley, after growing somewhat weary of family life.  I have been meaning to stop by and pay my respects but am not entirely certain just how you feel about seeing me after the incident involving myself and your mother.  It was certainly a serious mistake on my part but not serious enough.  I hope -- The last part runs down like a record on an old gramaphon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben driving his car (left to right)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. G. L. Robinson take great pleasure in announcing the wedding of their daughter... It runs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's car is being gassed up.  It is a huge gas station with dozens of pumps and many neon lights.  Ben runs to a series of vending machines.  He pushes quarters into them, receiving cigarettes, a sandwich, an apple, a cup of coffee.  Balancing them all carefully, he runs back to the car, climbs in, puts his purchases on top of the dashboard, hands the attendant a bill and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben driving (left to right) and eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey - I'm home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi - Sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they're having a wonderful time - spending the day at Mother's - she's teaching them to... It runs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben driving (left to right)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Mom and Dad.  You may have wondered why Elaine and I haven't written in such a long time, but the postal sytem here in Greenland isn't the most efficient.  Life among these wonderful natives... It runs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben driving (left to right)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you, Benjamin Braddock take this woman, Mrs. Robinson, for your Mother-in-law, to love, cherish and... It runs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben barely stops as he hands the change out the window of the low-slung sports car and up to the toll taker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben driving over bridge (left to right)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - you and Elaine have made such a wonderful marriage. I often laugh when I remember those nights at the Taft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes - how long ago that all seems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over; chuckling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never forget how peeved I was when I first... It runs down... PAN THE CAR past us and HOLD ON it as it disappears in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON BEN as he comes through the door.  MOVE WITH HIM as he wanders around the the commons room which is fi with STUDENTS.  Girls SINGING, couples necking; a MAN with a heavy knapsack.  Ben walks to a LADY RECEPTIONIST NO. 1, who sits at a reception desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too loudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine Robinson.  Does she live here? The Receptionist runs her pencil along a list of names under the glass top of her desk.  She finds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three-oh-eight.  Shall I call her for you? The Receptionist's hand moves to the receiver of a phone the desk.  Ben looks at her hand for several seconds.  He takes a step backward.  Her hand starts to lift the recei Ben moves backward, puts his hand up as though to stop he and shakes his head, speechlessly.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Looking at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Move with him as he moves past the students toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN AROUND CAMPUS in a circle, ending on a CLOSEUP OF BEN, standing in the middle of the deserted campus, looking around, lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. McCLEERY From the bottom of the stairway, shooting up.  MR. McCLEERY is the landlord of the rooming house.  They are climbing a flight of stairs, Mr. McCleery first, then Ben, carrying his suitcase. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a student?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly. Mr. McCleery stops and turns.  Ben almost runs into him. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said - not exactly - no. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I'm just sort of traveling through. Mr. McCleery takes a couple of steps up, Ben following and stops again. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to know who's living in my house.  I like to know what my boys are up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh. Mr. McCleery just looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not up too much, actually, I'm just visiting.  I mean - I've always wanted to see Berkeley. Mr. McCleery takes a couple more steps and stops again. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not one of those agitators?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those outside agitators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - no sir. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate that.  I won't stand for it. He looks at Ben searchingly, then turns and continues up the stairs and down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN THE ROOM in a circle, seeing a sink in one corner, a bed, a bureau, a table, a lamp, a chair, a window that overlooks a Berkeley street - ending in a CLOSEUP OF BEN, standing in the middle of it, looking lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWN.  The campus is empty except for Ben who, dressed carefully in his black suit, sits on a bench in the quadrangle outside of Wendell Hall.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: During which Ben remains static while the quadrangle and thet area around him fill up with students; walking, talk hurrying to class, strolling, sitting, reading, handing out petitions, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine comes out.  She walks, carrying her books, in Ben' direction.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He sees her and stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Approaching from the distance.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He stands.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT ELAINE
dialogues.text: As she walks, she is joined by another GIRL with whom she converses as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Watching.  He takes a step forward.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: As they approach, they are joined by a tall BOY with a beard.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He starts toward them, falters, straightens himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: They are getting quite near.  Suddenly they are joined by THREE AFRICAN EXCHANGE STUDENTS, in tribal robes. They all greet each other and continue to walk toward us.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He looks at the massed group moving toward him, horror taking over his face.  He starts forward.  As he passes Elaine and her friends he seems to take a deep breath and hold it. She stops and slowly turns to look in his direction.  Her companions also stop.  Ben changes his direction and makes a circle to his left as though he has just changed his mind.  He looks at her.  He does not stop walking. He makes a slow circle around her as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine.  Hey - what a surprise. (not quite looking at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say - I thought I remembered that you were going to school up here - well - we'll have to get together sometime - I'll be up here myself for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Elaine and the others staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - it certainly has been nice - I think I'm late - yes, I am - He turns and walks away from them.  They stand still watching them go.  He starts to walk faster and faster. They watch him as he gets further and further away and then breaks into a run.  He disappears in the distance. SOUND:  Footsteps running, a door opening and closing, footsteps running upstairs, a door opening and slamming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben leans with his back against the closed door, breathin heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben following and watching Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is sitting at a table by the window through which we can see the street.  He is drinking a beer.  Other tables are filled with students having animated discussio Ben starts to pour some beer from the bottle into the glass.  He stops as he sees something through the window. He leans forward. Elaine comes out of a bookstore across the street.  She crosses the street and moves to a bus stop.  He stands, fumbles in his pocket for money, puts a dollar on the table and rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben comes out of the door just as Elaine gets into a bus and the doors close behind her. The bus starts off.  Ben runs after it.  The bus gets to the next corner and stops for a red light.  Ben catches up with it, runs to the front door and knocks on the door.  The door opens and he climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is seated next to an OLDER LADY by the window immedia in front of the rear exit door.  She keeps looking out the window, almost holding her breath as she hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting closer as he moves past people toward her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me - I'm sorry - I wonder if I could get by - excuse me - There is a pause and then, immediately behind her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - how about this for a coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's face is right behind Elaine, between her and the ol lady sitting next to her.  Ben is standing on the steps to the rear exit door.  Elaine continues to look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in a little)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering where you were headed. Elaine doesn't answer.  The lady sitting next to Elaine takes a look at her, turns around and looks at Ben, then looks at Elaine again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm meeting someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.  Where? She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you meeting this person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Zoo.  They have a pretty good one here, do they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well, I haven't either.  I might just ride out there with you. Hold on them riding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Elaine are walking along in front of one of the outside animal cages.  Ben is walking a step or two behin Elaine.  He is darting glances to the right and left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he say he was going to meet you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he said by the monkey house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. She stops.  Ben stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - I would like to know what you're doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here?  In Berkelely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have this very pleasant room on Carter Street - and I've been getting to some classes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not enrolled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I just sit in.  They don't seem to mind.  They've been very congenial about it. She looks at him and starts to shake her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - you're - I don't know what to say - you're --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could get together some time and talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - really incredible -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a real feeling that this is the fellow. Elaine looks.  A good-looking young man is striding briskly toward them.  It is CARL SMITH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He certainly is a good walker. Carl strides up to them.  He takes the pipe out of his mouth and puts it in his pocket.  He reaches out and takes Elaine's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I late?  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought you said by the monkey house. Carl frowns and looks up over Elaine's shoulder at Ben. Ben smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Benjamin Braddock. Carl Smith.  Benjamin rode here with me on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to meet you, Ben. Ben steps forward and grasps Carl's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great meeting you, Carl. Carl steps back and puts an arm around Elaine's shoulder. The three of them look at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swell seeing you.  Have a good time. Ben turns and starts walking back the way he came.  Carl and Elaine turn and go in the opposite direction.  Ben stops after a few steps and walks over to one of the cages.  He grips the rail with his hand and looks back at:

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Walking away, his arm over her shoulder, his other hand gesturing with the pipe in it as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: As he watches them go.  His artificial smile disappears. The agony is such that he has to steady himself with his hand on the rail.  He turns his face away, toward the cage.  There is an animal in it, staring at Ben.  They look at each other.  There is a box - an automatic device with a recorded desciption of the animal - that begins to deliver its RECORDED MESSAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is standing by the window, looking out.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Elaine is walking up the street toward the rooming house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps to the other side of the window and peers out carefully.

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: Elaine turns in and disappears into the rooming house front door below.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He runs to the bed and puts the covers back into place. He goes to the window sill, picks up an empty beer can, crosses to the bureau, opens a bureau drawer.  He crosses to the wastepaper basket under the sink, bends down and takes a newspaper out of it.  He crosses to the chair and sits down.  He holds the newspaper in front of him.  It is hopelessly crumpled.  He gets up, crosses to the bureau, opens a drawer and takes out a traveling iron. He kneels down, puts the newspaper on the floor and tires to straighten it out with the iron. There is a KNOCK on the door.  He rises, puts the iron back in the drawer as quietly and quickly as he can, then back to the chair, sits down and holds the newspaper on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. There is another KNOCK.  Ben crosses to the door and open it.  Elaine is standing in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to ask you a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I want to know why you're here in Berkeley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because - I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it because I'm here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it is. Ben nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I think it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then!  Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I want you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do that, Benjamin? Ben moves in behind her and puts his hand on her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you just hate everything? How could you possibly rape my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say rape her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - how you - how anyone - could do a thing like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to tell me what she said. He touches her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it isn't true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel well. Ben pushes her down softly onto the bed.  He kneels along side her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me. Ben sits next to her and puts his hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she was having a drink in the hotel with a friend. You waited for her in the parking lot and told her she was too drunk to drive home and that you would get her a room for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you took her upstairs and you raped her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - that is not what happened. She puts her hands on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right - but listen to me. What happened was there was this party at my parents.  I drove your mother home - then we went upstairs to see your portrait - Elaine tightens her arms around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and when we got up in the room she starts taking her her clothes off - and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - this is my mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - suddenly there she was without any clothes on - I mean really naked - Ben is almost lying on top of her.  Elaine screams - a long, loud scream.  Ben looks at her.  He leaps off the bed and runs to the sink.  He fills a glass with water and brings it to Elaine.  He starts toward the door. SOUND OF FOOTESTEPS on the stairway and in the hall. Ben goes to the closet, opens the door, takes a jacket from a hanger and puts it on. SOUND:  A KNOCK on the door. MR. McCLEERY'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on in there? Elaine sits up and drinks the water.  Ben looks at her then goes to the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh - hello, Mr. McCleery. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who screamed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Mr. McCleery. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screaming isn't all right.  Not in my house it isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a visitor.  But it's all right now. Several BOYS are gathering in the hallway trying to see into the room.  Ben edges through the door into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - she's all right.  She's upset and she screamed.  But she's okay now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I get the cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the cops. He starts for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - wait a minute.  Now damn it - look. He opens the door a little way.  They all try to see in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See - she's just having some water.  Now there's no need for the cops or anything. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, boys - I think you can get back to your rooms.  I don't think we'll have any more of this agitation.  Will we, Braddock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. The boys start back to their rooms.  Mr. McCleery and Ben stand and look at each other for a few seconds. MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you out of here. Mr. McCleery turns away and walks down the hall and start down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McCleery? MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.  Out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? MR. McCLEERY (going down the stairs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't like you. Mr. McCleery disappears down the stairs.  Ben turns and goes back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is standing at the sink.  She is putting water on her face.  Ben goes to the closet and takes out his suit- case and carries it to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I screamed. Ben opens the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin, when you came up here, what did you think was going to happen between us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - right now I don't feel like talking much.  I'm sorry about everything but I think I'll just do this now. He stands, looking into the empty suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I just sit here while you're packing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want. Elaine sits in the chair.  She watches him as he goes to the bureau, takes some shirts from a drawer and puts them in the suitcase, then goes back to the bureau.  He gets down on his knees and looks under the bureau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have it on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I have two.  The other one is the one I'm looking for. (he reaches under the bureau)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? (he brings out a marble)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from my grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The belt I'm looking for was from my grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Ben takes the marble to the suitcase and packs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He goes back to the bureau, gets some socks and underwear and carries them to the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - where are you going? He goes back to the bureau, opens a drawer, takes out some T-shirts and the beer can and carries them to the suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - you're going to have to stop asking me that. He packs the T-shirts, then carries the beer can back to the bureau and puts it back in the drawer, takes some ties from the drawer and crosses to the suitcase.  Elaine gets up, goes to the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to leave tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to go anywhere until you have a definite plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Elaine -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. She walks out, shutting the door behind her.  He crosses to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past Ben, through the window, we see Elaine walking away. She walks the length of the street and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben asleep in his bed.  Suddenly he sits up.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Standing in the darkness by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? He gets out of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a step forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you kiss me! He goes to her and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you marry me? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?  You might marry me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about tomorrow?  I don't mean to be pushy but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I don't know what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you're confused? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - look - don't be confused. We're getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go back now. She goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - are you serious about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She opens the door and steps into the hall.  He goes to t door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - let's get together sometime. He closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God!

dialogues.speaker: TELEGRAM
dialogues.text: addressed to MR. BENJAMIN BRADDOCK SOUND:  FOOTSTEPS descending stairs.  Someone WHISTLING. The FOOTSTEPS and WHISTLING get nearer and stop. Hands come in and pick up telegram, open the envelope and unfold, the telegram reads: LEAVE BERKELEY IMMEDIATELY OR SERIOUS REPEAT SERIOUS TROUBLE WILL RESULT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP TO BEN.  He crumples the telegram in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP ONE BEN'S HAND fiddling with the crumpled telegr Students are moving quickly from building to building. Ben is walking alongside Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could go down and get our blood tests tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or this afternoon.  It's a good day for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin - I haven't even said I'll marry you yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need our Birth Certificates. I happen to have mine with me. Where's yours? They move up the steps of a classroom building.  Ben pushes through a lot of students to keep up with Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk down a corridor.  On each side are open doors to classrooms with students filing into each of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't think it would work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't it? A bell rings.  Elaine turns into one of the doors.  Ben is left in the hall.  He looks around.  All the doors in the classrooms close.  He leans against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Standing poised by the door.  The bell rings.  The classr doors open and students start to file out.  Elaine comes out of the classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't think it would... Elaine starts walking down the corridor towards the exit Ben follows her, moving out of the way of the other stude

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine and twenty other girls are in basketball uniforms. Two teams of girls are playing basketball.  Elaine sits on the bench, watching.  Ben stands behind her.  The girl are shouting and clapping and jumping up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow then - can we get our blood tests tomorrow morning? She turns and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just drag me off if you want to marry me so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I just drag you off?  All right - I will. Right after we get the blood tests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I have to see Carl first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl who? Elaine jumps up, applauding a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Smith.  He's a medical student.  We've known him for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who - that guy at the Zoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have to see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- I said I might marry him. Elaine and several other girls run onto the court as a number of girls run off the court to the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling after her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is seated across a study table from Elaine.  There ar many other students scattered around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he do it?  Did he get down on his knees?  He didn't get down on his knees, I hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Benjamin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what did he say?  I'm curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he thought we'd make a pretty good team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.  He said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he do it? She starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to know where it happened? She starts to move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't in his car, was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Elaine are standing at the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we getting married tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day after tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we are and maybe we aren't. She goes through the doorway into Wendell Hall.  Ben rema standing in exactly the same positin.  After a few moment the door opens and Elaine comes out, steps quickly to Ben kisses him, then runs back inside.  Ben turns and starts away from the door.  The door opens again.  Ben turns bac and takes a step toward the door, smiling expectantly.  A tall bearded MAN comes out and goes past Ben.  Ben breaks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window of a hippy jewelry store we see a sale woman modeling a ring for Ben.  He nods, she takes it off puts it in a box and gives it to him.  He pays for it and exits PAST CAMERA, WHISTLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben enters carrying four oddly shaped boxes and some flow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is whistling happily as he runs up the stairs two at time.  He opens the door to his room and steps in.  The r is dark.  The figure of a MAN is silhouetted against the window.  Ben freezes just inside the door.  There is a lo pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want - do you want to try and tell me why you did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Robinson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a special grudge against me?  Do you feel a particularly strong resentment for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something I've said that's caused this contempt?  Or is it just the things I stand for that you despise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nothing to do with you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Ben, it was quite a bit to do with me. Ben takes a step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look - please -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, I think we're two civilized human beings.  Do you think it's necessary to threaten each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not threatening you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to unclench your fists, please?  Thank you.  I can see in the dark, you know.  I've been here quite a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am trying to tell you I have no personal feelings about you, Mr. Robinson.  I am trying to tell you I do not resent you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't respect me terribly much either, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't think we have a whole lot to say to each other, Ben.  I do think you should know the consequences of what you've done.  I do think you should know that my wife and I are getting a divorce soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shouldn't make any difference what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's quite a statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.  We got - we got into bed with each other.  But it was nothing.  It was nothing at all.  We might - we might just as well have been shaking hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking hands.  Well, that's not saying much for my wife, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shout at me, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is - I don't love your wife.  I love your daughter, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - I'm sure you think you do, Ben, but after a few times in bed with Elaine I feel quite sure you'd get over that as quickly as you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I've talked about this enough.  I don't know how far I can go, Ben.  I don't know if I can prosecute or not, but I think maybe I can.
