In the light of what's happened I think maybe I can get you behind bars if you ever look at my daughter again. I have seen Elaine and I have spent the afternoon taking steps to insure... Mr. Robinson climbs across the bed to get to the door. Ben takes a step toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me, Ben! Mr. Robinson stands at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to mince words with you.  As far as Elaine's concerned you're to get her out of your filthy mind right now.  Is that perfectly clear ro you?  That's all, Ben.  You'll pardon me if I don't shake hands with you. Mr. Robinson opens the door and starts into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you are filth. Mr. Robinson turns back from the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you are scum. Mr. Robinson starts down the stairs.  Mr. McCleery is standing on the stairway, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a degenerate! Mr. Robinson turns and goes down the stairs, past Mr. McCleery who looks up at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He walks to the door, looks out into the hall at Mr. McCleery, then shuts the door.  Ben goes to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the street below, Mr. Robinson getting into a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs out of his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben runs down the stairs.  Mr. McCleery is standing by the pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McCleery - do you have some change?  I need to use the phone? MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes out some money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look - I'll give you ten dollars for a dime - I'll give you twenty - for God's sake, will you let me use that phone? MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to call the police now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I make one phone call first? MR. McCLEERY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out! Ben stuffs the money back in his pocket and runs down the stairs and out of the building.  Through the door we see him run down the street and out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hanging up phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine Robinson has left the school.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ben reacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her roommate is coming down with a note for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elvator at the end of the hall opens and a fat GIRL walks toward us with an envelope in her hand.  She walks into CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben driving his car (right to left) SOUND: An ENVELOPE being RIPPED OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Benjamin - I promise you some- say I will write a long letter about everything but right now I can't thank and all I can say to you is please forgive me because I know what I'm doing is the best thing for you.  My father is so upset you've got to understand.  I love you, but it would never work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben's car is parked two blocks from the Robinson house.  Ben has just left the car and is making his way t the Robinson backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben climbs a fence into the backyard and moves to the hou He looks up at Elaine's bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whispered shout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - Elaine - He picks up a pebble and throws it at the window.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: He moves to the back door, takes off his shoes, puts them into his jacket pockets, tries the back door.  It opens and he goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no lights.  Ben moves through the house into th hall and up the stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben goes to the door of Elaine's room and looks in.  Ther is a light on in the room and the sound of someone moving around.  He goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ben moves further into the room, Mrs. Robinson, carryi some of Elaine's clothes, comes out of Elaine's closet an moves past Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Benjamin. She does not stop, but walks casually past him into the h

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ben follows her through the hall into Mrs. Robinson's roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson, without stopping, puts Elaine's clothes down next to a half-packed open suitcase on her bed and moves to a telephone on the night table.  She lifts the receiver and dials zero.  Ben follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  Get me the police, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be with you in a moment, Benjamin. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you send a police car to twelve hundred Glenview Road.  We have a burgler here.  Just a second.  I'll ask him. (to Ben)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you armed? (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - I don't believe he is.  Thank you. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we have everything quite under control now, Benjamin.  Would you like a quick drink before you go? She picks up a glass from the night table and takes a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stop me from seeing her, Mrs. Robinson.  I'll find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry we won't be able to invite you to the wedding, Benjamin, but the arrangements have been so rushed -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell have you done? SOUND of SEVERAL CARS TURNING INTO DRIVEWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh.  I don't think you'll have time for that drink after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. The cars have reached the top of the driveway.  SOUND of the SQUEAL of BRAKES and CAR DOORS OPENING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben dives head first into the hall, scrambles to his feet and runs to the back of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben comes through the back door, runs to the back fence and vaults it.  Lights start to go on in the house behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, driving rapidly.  He jams on the brakes and stops the car in the middle of the street.  Cars, HONKING move around him as he sits, staring ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wedding!  God Damn it - wedding! People are YELLING as him from the cars going by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl - I think you and Elaine will make a good team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's right, Elaine.  You and I will make a darned good team. Ben swings the car around in a U-turn and speeds off in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Ben driving rapidly (left to right) past the landmarks established on the previous drive to Berkeley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have two Carl Smiths.  Is it Carl with a "C" or a "K"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Karl Smith with a "K" teaches History of Advertising -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one with the "C", Carl Smith Junior, is in our medical school. He lives at Gamma Delta Tau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben pulls up in front of the Gamma Delta Tau house.  He g out of the car.  He is haggard, tired and unshaven.  The car is mud-spattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben enters the hall.  Through a door can be seen a DOZEN OR SO FRATERNITY BROTHERS seated at a table chowing down. It is breakfast.  Ben walks into the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fraternity brothers are eating and talking noisily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say - fellows - They stop eating and turn toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do any of you fellows know where Carl Smith is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took off in the middle of the night to get married. He goes back to his breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proabaly one step ahead of the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you happen to know where he's getting married?  I'm supposed to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask Carter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you happen to know where I might find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably still in the sack. He's always in the sack. They start to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or in the can. They all laugh a great deal.  Ben gives a polite smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large steam-filled room with a row of FRATERNITY BROTHERS in front of a row of sinks, brushing, combing, shaving, etc.  Ben is standing at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Carter - where's the Make Out King getting married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echo sound)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling in the direc- tion of Carter's voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't happen to know exactly where the Make Out King is getting married, do you?  I'm supposed to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Maybe at his old man's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give the bride a message for me. Tell her to act surprised. A great deal of laughter follows this gem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben driving (right to left).  The laughter from the previ scene can still be heard for a moment. Ben is exhausted-looking.  He opens the windows, turns th radio on and rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: The car, moving speedily (right to left) south on the Highway to Santa Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT the CAR leaving the freeway under a SANTA BARBARA si The car swings onto an off ramp and down to a street, tur into a gas station and stops near the office.  Ben gets out of the car and runs into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on the office wall reads 2:05.  The gas station ATTENDANT is sitting reading a stock car magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a phone? The attendant points.  Ben reaches for the phone book hanging under the pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: The front of it says SANTA BARBARA TELEPHONE DIRECTORY. Ben opens it to the S's.  His finger runs down to the Smiths.  There is at least a half a page of them.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Ben's finger runs up and down and stops at the name: Smith, Carl W., M.D.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He inserts a dime and dials.  The attendant watches him. SOUND of BUZZING from the phone.  It CLICKS open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello - who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Dr. Smith's answering service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the doctor anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - you see - the doctor is at his son's wedding, but I'm sure it's over by now.  He should be checking in any moment -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.  I am Dr. Smith's brother - Reverend Smith - and I am supposed to perform the ceremony. I just got in - from - Portland - and I've forgotten what church - you see?

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: The attendant puts down his magazine and stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well - I'm not sure - but you might try the First Presbyterian. That's on Allan Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly hope you -

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Ben hangs up the phone.  He turns to the attendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allan Street.  Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspiciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six blocks up - three blocks over. Ben runs out of the office.  The attendant goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: getting into car.  The attendant is in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need any gas, Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a priest - I'm a minister. The car drives out of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car comes toward us through the traffic.  It stops in the intersection to make the turn.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: SOUND:  THE ENGINE FAILING.  Ben looks down.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: The needle is on "E".

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He pumps the gas pedal.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: It makes the turn and rolls to a stop by the curb.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He jumps out of the car, leaving the door open, and starts to run down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up ahead on the other side of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Presbyterian Church.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Running across the street.  He stops for a moment and loo around.  There are a number of cars parked in front of th church.  Among them is Mrs. Robinson's car.  Ben runs by it and up the steps to the front doors of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls at the doors.  They are locked.  Through the gla doors, we can see to the front of the church where the wedding ceremony is taking place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: running around the side of the church.  There are glass windows and doors through which, as he runs, we can see the ceremony continuing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben runs, looking for an entrance.  He goes all the way around the church and stops at a side door.  He opens the door and goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The balcony is between two huge windows, one of which loo out on the lawn outside, the other looks into the interio of the church where the ceremony is taking place.  The su is coming through the window.  Ben stops and looks throug the inside window.  The minister is just closing the book He says something and Carl and Elaine kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus - God - no - He puts his hands up against the glass and slumps.  The minister shakes hands with Carl, then takes Elaine's hand The ORGAN music starts to THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straightening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! He moves to the center of the window and begins to POUND on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - Elaine! Ben's shadow is thrown across the celebrants.  They all turn around and look up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is like a trapped moth, beating on the window and yel soundlessly.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: She looks up at Ben with a small, triumphant smile.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: looking up at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: looking up at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: looking up at Ben.  She moves down the aisle toward him, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Mr. Robinson, Carl, and Mrs. Robinson are moving toward Elaine.  The ORGAN is playing LOUDLY.  Ben's voice can be heard SHOUTING Elaine's name.  The POUNDING on the glass can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that guy?  What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take care of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too late. The other guests are adlibbing their confusion.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: She turns back toward her mother, father and Carl as they come toward her.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: looking at them.  ALL SOUND STOPS, except for Ben's voice in the distance shouting "ELAIN ELAINE ELAINE."

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Frozen frame.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Frozen frame.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Frozen frame.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Her face turning quickly to look up at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Frozen frame.  His face twisted with passion, his body spread-eagled against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: ELAINE
dialogues.text: looking up at Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben! The SOUND of the ORGAN and the guests' VOICES starts agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to go back down the stairs.  He reaches the bottom of the stairs and goes through a door which leads into the vestibule of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Robinson is waiting for Ben, crouching, his arms spre Behind him is Elaine.  Ben moves toward them.  Mr. Robins grabs Ben around the waist.  Ben twists away.  Mr. Robins grabs Ben's collar and tears his jacket half off.  Ben turns and hits Mr. Robinson in the face.  Mr. Robinson falls down.  Ben moves to Elaine and grabs her hand.  He pulls her toward the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on - don't faint.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: His back to the action, clawing away at the organ obliviously.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: A man in clerical garb is guarding the door.  Ben and Elaine move toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of my way! Carl steps in and grabs Ben from behind.  Ben breaks Carl's hold and picks up a gold cross off a nearby stand. He begins to swing it, advancing toward Carl.  Carl backs up toward the other guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Robinson steps to Elaine.  She reaches out and takes Elaine's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine - it's too late. Elaine pulls her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT BEN
dialogues.text: He turns toward the man standing in front of the door and raises the cross over his head.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE
dialogues.text: The man moves away from the door.  Elaine steps forward and opens the door.  She and Ben go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben jams the cross through the handles of the door.  He grabs Elaine's wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, Elaine, run! They start to run.  Elaine trips and falls.  Ben helps he up and they continue to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside the church vestibule.  Through the glass doors, we can see Elaine and Ben running down the street. The wedding party members are tugging furiously at the jammed doors.  Mrs. Robinson turns toward us and calmly begins to put on her gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Elaine running along the sidewalk.  Ben holds her hand and is pulling her.  She still holds her flowers.  They run to a bus that is just closing its doors.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He bangs on the closed door of the bus.  The door opens. Ben climbs the step into the bus and pulls Elaine up after him.  The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben holds out a dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the end. The driver takes the bill and gives Ben some change. Ben turns and pulls Elaine along to the back of the bus. He pushes her into one of the seats and sits beside her.  Ben looks toward the front of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the driver and the passengers, all turned around in their seats and looking back at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.  Let's get this bus moving!

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: He turns and starts the bus.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: They are breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window in the back of the bus the church can be seen receding in the distance.  There seem to be a number of men dressed in black running around in the street in front of it.
